channel.title: Porfolio on Christopher Pintado
channel.description: Recent content in my Porfolio on Christopher Pintado

item.title: Analytical Review for Consolidating Habitat Mapping Within Europe: Insights from Portugal, Spain, and France
item.description: This paper addresses the challenges of standardizing habitat classification across three conterminous European countries by presenting a comparative analysis of habitat data for Portugal, Spain and France with focus on the cross-border regions between these countries. This master's dissertation contributes to the InCASE project -In Situ showcase Supporting Climate and Environmental Monitoring in Europe- funded by the European Commission in support to the European Environmental Agency (EEA) and the Copernicus InSitu Component

item.title: Experimental Approaches for Geometric Correction
item.description: GoExperimental outlook for geometric correction of various remote imaging sources utilizing manual and automatics approach. This project tries to convey the procedure of geometric corrections of satellite images that are not georeferenced directly, and are assigned arbitrary coordinate units of pixels, and converting them into a desired georeferenced coordinate system, using both manual and automatic models.

item.title: Radiometric Image Correction
item.description: Having geometrically referenced images poses challenges, including atmospheric conditions, varied illumination due to solar position at acquisition time, and reliefinduced shadows. These factors deviate from the desired traits for remote sensing. This endeavor aims to outline the procedures involved in acquiring and radiometrically correcting satellite orthoimages, like Landsat-5 TM, utilizing both manual and automatic applications. The goal of radiometric correction is to transform digital sensor values into meaningful physical quantities, such as reflectance.

item.title: Project 4: Drug Discovery using Machine Learning
item.description: Description: The goal of this project is to use data from the ChEMBL Database to train a model that can predict the activity of a potential drug based on its chemical properties. This can be used to study the chemical features that are critical in the drug effectiveness, and to study best molecular targets to act upon the specific disease. In this project I will focus on studying possible drugs targeting proteins with a role in prostate cancer development üß´üî¨‚öô.

item.title: Project 5: Flower classification using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)
item.description: Description: In this image classification project, I trained a CNN model capable of classifying 5 types of flowers with a 98% accuracy by using transfer learning and data augmentation. üåºüå∑üåª‚ùì See full code here. Link to GitHub Repository Code and Resources Used Python Version: 3.7 Packages: pandas, numpy, random, os, cv2, pathlib, PIL, sklearn, matplotlib, seaborn, tensorflow (2.3.1) and keras (2.4.0). 1. Load and inspect the data: Create the path list using glob

item.title: Project 6: Car Price Estimator
item.description: Description: An end-to-end project in which I scrape , prepare, analyse the data, find a model and create a web app able to accurately predict second hand prices cars in Spain. This is a great tool to have if you are looking for a second car or if you want to sell yours. üöóüöìüöïüöêüöôüöìüí® Code and Resources Used: Python Version: 3.7 Packages: pandas, numpy, datetime, re, requests, csv, sklearn, matplotlib, seaborn, plotly, pickle, flask, jsonify, json and heroku.

item.title: Project 7: Covid-19 Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Goal of the project: To perform EDA of covid data, and create a tool to generate visually appealing plots to get insight into the evolution of the pandemia. See full project code here Link to GitHub Repository Creation of an EDA Covid app and Exploratory Data Analyses of Covid Data. Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID‚Äë19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). It was first identified in December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China, and has resulted in an ongoing pandemic.

item.title: Project 8: Predicting Rental Bike Usage
item.description: Description: I will be using a dataset containing information from a bicycle rental company called capital bikeshare located in Washington D.C founded in 2010. The aim is to use the data from the past 10 years (2010-2020) to develop a model that can predict bicycle usage (Number of trips and total time ride usage) at a given day. üö≤üö≤‚òîüåûüïí Code and Resources Used: Python Version: 3.7 Packages: pandas, numpy, datetime, os, sklearn, matplotlib, seaborn, plotly.

item.title: Project 9: Red Wine Quality Classification
item.description: Description: In this project we will tackle a multi-classification problem using supervised ML on a well-known dataset containing red wine quality parameters. Find the dataset here. This dataset contains quality parameters for 1596 red-wines, which we can use to build a model that predicts red wine quality. Following analyses of feature distribution and data preprocessing, several classification models were trained and their performance assessed. Three models (SVC, RFC and ETC) were chosed, tuned and ensembled using sorf voting classifier üç∑‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

item.title: Project 10: BoardGames Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Description üé≠üé≤üé¥‚ô†üß©: An Exploratory Data Analyses (EDA) project in which a board game database is analysed to investigate what factors drive sales for these products. Code and Resources Used Python Version: 3.7 Packages: pandas, numpy, datetime, scipy, sklearn, matplotlib, seaborn, BeautifulSoup, requests, re. See full project here. Link to GitHub Repository 1. Data cleaning and feature engineering: Handled Nan values: Columns with more than 40 % nan values were directly removed.

item.title: Project 11: Predicting the outcome of tennis matches
item.description: Summary: I scrapped the data from ATP tournaments, matches and players from 1999 to 2020 (> 78000 matches). I performed data cleaning steps and feature engineering to create information of the players form at the moment of the upcoming match. üéæüèÜü•á Exploratory data analyses were carried out to get insight into the features correlation and distribution. This allowed to select the most relevant features for the model.

item.title: Project 12: House Rental Price Predictor
item.description: Summary: Scraped over 2000 house rent information from https://www.pisos.com/ using python and the beautifulsoup library. Performed data cleaning steps and removed outliers. Exploratory Data Analyses shed light into the most important parameters driving house prices in Spain. These parameters were chosen in the model building process. Optimized Linear, Decission Tree, Random Forest, Support Vector Regressors using GridsearchCV to find the best model üí≤üí≤üèöüè†üí≤‚õ™üí≤.

item.title: Project 13: Madrid House Price Estimator
item.description: Summary: Performed data cleaning steps and removed outliers. Exploratory Data Analyses shed light into the most important parameters driving house prices in Spain.These parameters were chosen in the model building process. Optimized Linear, Decission Tree and Random Forest Regressors using GridsearchCV to reach the best model. Wrote a python flask server that uses the saved model to serve http requests. Built a website in html, css and javascript that allows user to predict rental prices in Madrid üèòüí≤üí≤üèöüè†üí≤‚õ™.

item.title: Project 14: Data Science Salary Estimator
item.description: Summary: Created a tool that estimates data science salaries to help data scientists negotiate their income when they get a job. Scraped over 1000 job descriptions from glassdoor using python and selenium. Engineered features from the text of each job description to quantify the value companies put on python, excel, aws, and spark. Optimized Linear, Lasso, and Random Forest Regressors using GridsearchCV to reach the best model üí≤üìäüëÄ

item.title: A taste of my experience as crop researcher
item.description: Description üî¨üß¨üß´üå±üåæ: In this section I would like to give a brief example of all the steps involved in the data analysis process as a crop scientist. Here I provide a simple experiment that I carried out during my PhD as example. Furthermore, I discuss my experience analysing complex biological data, and how I summarized 300Gb of proteomic data into to a single figure. I think that this comes to show the importance of learning data analytic skills and tools.

item.title: A study on tomato plants-Botrytis Cinerea interactions.
item.description: Description üî¨üß¨üß´üå±üåæ: The goal of this project was to better understand the role of a set of tomato pathogenesis-related genes (PR genes) agaist an economically devastating fungus (B.cinerea). Two main aspects of these genes were studied: 1. PR gene expression level by q-RT-PCR: During this experiment, we analized the constitutive expression level of the PR genes in different tomato plant parts (Figure 1). In order to do so, plant samples were immediately snap-frozen and crushed in liquid nitrogen and stored at -80¬∞C.
